title: Why the old-fashioned pager still has a place in my heart
text:
The final, dying bleeps from Japan’s last remaining pagers were heard today. To mark the occasion, a funeral company in Tokyo set up a memorial to allow citizens to pay their respects to the classic gadget.

The country’s last remaining pager provider, Tokyo Telemessage, was forced to close its service after user numbers fell to 1,500 people. That’s a far cry from their peak of 10 million in 1996, just ahead of the mobile phone revolution. Pagers, we hardly knew ye.

Despite appearances, I am slightly too young to remember pagers in widespread use, much less using one myself. However, there is a memory of them being the epitome of wealth and cool in the early nineties. Favoured by city slickers...
